title: José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero - Wikipedia
snippet: Although José Borrell was the official candidate, Zapatero played an important role in that campaign (as is usual in Spain). His style's defining word is (buen) talante, roughly "pleasantness", "niceness" or "good disposition", which is in brisk and carefully chosen contrast with the more ...

title: José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero | Spanish PM, Socialist Leader | Britannica
snippet: Zapatero announced in April 2011 that he would not seek another term as prime minister, but that news failed to buoy the PSOE, which fared poorly in another round of regional elections held the following month. In July 2011, as Spain’s economy continued to flounder, Zapatero announced that he would advance the date of the next general election from March 2012 to November 2011.

title: José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero President of Spain
snippet: Internationally, Zapatero worked for peace and poverty reduction, promoting the creation of the UN Alliance of Civilizations, the Water Fund in Latin America, and the Debt for Education debt swaps. After leaving the Presidency in 2011, José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero published “The Dilemma: 600 days of vertigo” in 2013, an account of his most difficult decisions between 2008 and 2011.

title: La Moncloa. 26/09/2018. José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero [Presidents since 1978]
snippet: In March 2008, José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero began his second term of office.

title: José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero | World Leaders Forum
snippet: After being elected deputy in the national Parliament five times, Zapatero was elected as president of the government in 2004. He was again elected to that position in 2008. He is well known for his domestic agenda of civic rights and the promotion of gender equality. Internationally, he launched the initiative for the Alliance of Civilizations in his first speech at the UN as President of Spain and he is a committed leader in the fight against poverty and the search for peace.
